root.TEXT:
Record date: 2075-08-08
Reason for Visit
62 y.o. man, pt of Dr. Kidd, presents w/ c/o R hand pain x 1d. Has sharp pain, starts in thumb, radiates proximally up arm to biceps area. Pain lasts several minutes, resolves spontaneously. Occurs several times a day, not reated to arm movement. He denies trauma to area, recent falls, denies swelling, redness, rashes, weakness.
Problems
Diabetes mellitus
Hypertension
H/O Seizure disorder : Status post head trauma
H/O Alcohol abuse
Medications
Aspirin (ACETYLSALICYLIC Acid) 81MG TABLET CHEWABLE take 1 Tablet(s) PO QD , Take as directed
Glucophage (METFORMIN) 500MG TABLET take 1 Tablet(s) PO TID x 90 days
Micronase (GLYBURIDE) 10 MG (5MG TABLET take 2) PO BID x 90 days
Tegretol (CARBAMAZEPINE) 200MG TABLET take 1 Tablet(s) PO TID x 90 days
Monopril (FOSINOPRIL Sodium) 20MG TABLET take 1 Tablet(s) PO QD x 90 days
Lipitor (ATORVASTATIN) 10MG TABLET take 1 Tablet(s) PO QD , Take as directed
Hctz (HYDROCHLOROTHIAZIDE) 25MG TABLET take 1 Tablet(s) PO QD x 90 days, Take as directed
Allergies
NKA
Social History
legally blind, also has MR; lives w/ sister Urquiza who is his care taker.
Vital Signs
BLOOD PRESSURE 118/74
PULSE 72
WEIGHT 192 lb
Physical Exam
Gen: WDWN man, NAD
Extrem: no edema; radial and p.t. pulses 2+ bilat; R UE - no deformity, no edema; well healed surgical scar over R bicpes area; non-tender in biceps/triceps, forearm area; mild tenderness in distal thumb; full ROM of elbow, wrist, fingers, shoulder w/out pain; motor 5/5 in all UE muscle groups. radial, brachial pulses 2+; hand warm, good cap refill.
Assessment and Plan
62 y.o. man w/ sharp intermitent pain in R UE - etiology unclear given lack of trauma and lack of physical findings on exam; will do hand film to assess for occult fracture or other abnormality; for now, ibuprofen prn. I recommended pt f/u w/ Dr. Kidd in next few weeks (no showed 12/74 appt, next appt 10/75). Sister Urquiza will call for appt. RTC if pain persists.
